agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that offers community activities and assistance.
service_description: Provides staple items such as vegetables, bakery items, and prepackaged meals. Items vary based on donations.  Distribution is based on a first come, first serve basis.
site_details: Sign in upon arriving
site_schedule: Oct 30-31; 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Nov 1st; 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Nov 2-3; noon-7pm
Breakfast: Mon-Fri 9am-10am -- Lunch: Mon-Fri noon-1pm -- Monthly last Sat 11am-noon
site_eligibility: Open -- Living in Jefferson County -- Limit of one bag per individual

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers services which promote workforce development.
service_description: Provides child care vouchers for low-income families who are working or in school. Families under 100% of the federal poverty level may receive free child care; families between 100-127% of the poverty level may receive child care at a sliding-scale rate.
site_details: Visit the website for an application. -- After application is reviewed, applicants will be contacted to schedule an individual appointment. -- After the individual appointment, approved applicants will be placed on a wait list or informed of open enrollment events for their region.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Class days and times vary by location
site_eligibility: Living in Clark, Decatur, Floyd, Harrison, Jackson, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, Scott, Switzerland, or Washington County -- Parents of children birth through age 12 (or up to 18, if child is disabled) -- Working or enrolled in school -- Income under 127% federal poverty guideline -- Child receiving assistance must be a US Citizen or qualified legal alien [Note: Some requirements may be waived for licensed foster parents seeking care for foster children, or for parents with a referral from the Department of Child Services (DCS) or from TANF/IMPACT].

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers services which promote workforce development.
service_description: Offering adult literacy program, English as a Second Language, individual tutoring for all ages, and volunteer opportunities
site_details: Call or visit the website for information
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Check the website for class times
Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Check the website for class times
Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Check the website for class times
Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Check the website for class times
site_eligibility: Age 16 and up

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides free and confidential testing for Blood Pressure, Blood Sugar, Hepatitis C, and HIV.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 9am-4pm; Wed by appointment
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing comprehensive behavioral health, addiction, and related services.
service_description: Provides assessment and treatment to children facing emotional and behavioral problems. Treatment may include individual counseling, family counseling, group therapy, case management, or psychiatric services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Jefferson County -- Youth ages 0-17

agency_desc: A nonprofit that opens doors to better quality lives through comprehensive services and community partnerships.
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm  Classes: All day classes available
site_eligibility: Living in Jefferson, Jennings, or Scott County -- Ages 3-5 years-old (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level

agency_name: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF SOUTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that matches youth with caring mentors.
site_name: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF SOUTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Matches children in need with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests and goals. Mentors volunteer two to four times per month for at least one year.
site_details: To Volunteer: Call or email to request an application. -- To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or email to request an enrollment form.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 9am-4pm -- Services are provided weekends, evening, and out-of-school times.
Office: Mon-Fri 9am-4pm -- Services are provided weekends, evening, and out-of-school times.
site_eligibility: Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older (or younger for certain programs) -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-17 at time of enrollment (may stay in program to age 18)

agency_desc: A government agency offering recycling services.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA RECYCLING DISTRICT - JEFFERSON COUNTY
service_description: Provides two special collection days throughout the year for all counties except Jefferson, which accepts hazardous material year-around for residents of all serviced counties.
site_details: Call or visit the website for collection days.
site_schedule: Office: Mon Fri 7am-3pm -- Collection Days: Vary
Office: Mon Fri 7am-3pm -- Collection Days: Vary
Office: Mon Fri 7am-3pm -- Collection Days: Vary
Recycling: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm; Monthly 2nd and 4th Sat 8am-noon; 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-7pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs Noon-5pm; Sat 8am-noon
Recycling: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm; Monthly 2nd and 4th Sat 8am-noon; 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-7pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs Noon-5pm; Sat 8am-noon
Recycling: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm; Monthly 2nd and 4th Sat 8am-noon; 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-7pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs Noon-5pm; Sat 8am-noon

Recycling: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm; Monthly 2nd and 4th Sat 8am-noon; 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-7pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs Noon-5pm; Sat 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Open; serves Franklin, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, Scott, and Switzerland County

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
site_schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: Audiology healthcare provider focused on providing patient care while improving your quality of life by finding the best possible solutions for your hearing needs
service_description: Providing audiological testing, and hearing aids and other products for individuals with hearing loss
site_details: Visit the website or call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Providing food pantry services monthly; one time per month, program offers a food giveaway to those in need.
site_details: Walk-in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Local community Presbyterian church focused on learning from the past, acting in the present to build for the future
service_description: Offers very limited temporary financial assistance with rent, prescriptions, and utilities on a case by case basis.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Jefferson County -- Limit one visit every six months

agency_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF JEFFERSON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF JEFFERSON COUNTY
service_description: Provides a positive, supervised environment for young people after school and over the summer. Programs emphasize character and leadership, education and career development, the arts, life skills, health and fitness, sports, and recreation.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 4-18 years-old

agency_desc: Not-commerical organization focused on inspiring all girls to be strong, smart, and bold
service_description: Providing youth enrichment program services; recreational and educational activities after school and during the summer.
site_details: Registration required
site_eligibility: Girls age 5-18

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including temporary financial assistance and a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Chelsea, Deputy, Hanover, Lexington, or Kent

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization assisting with pregnancy and sexually-transmitted disease concerns.
service_description: Provides pregnancy tests, ultrasounds, sexually transmitted disease screening, and peer counseling.
site_details: Call to make appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Providing a birthing program focusing on all stages of pregnancy, labor and delivery, prenatal classes, infant CPR classes, and offers a variety of prenatal and family education classes, after delivery, registered nurses trained in obstetrics provide home visits.
site_details: Call for appointment. -- Visit www.kdhmadison.org/services/maternity for class schedule.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: MADISON AND JEFFERSON COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides various funding opportunities for community organizations.
site_name: MADISON AND JEFFERSON COUNTY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION
service_description: Providing community foundation working to improve quality of life by promoting charitable giving, connecting donors to the critical needs of the community, and evaluating and addressing community issues
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Community organizations

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Hanover in Jefferson County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Hanover in Jefferson County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Jefferson County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Hanover in Jefferson County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Madison in Jefferson County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Madison in Jefferson County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Jefferson County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Madison in Jefferson County

agency_name: SOUTHWEST JEFFERSON COUNTY CONSOLIDATED SCHOOL CORPORATION
agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
site_name: SOUTHWEST JEFFERSON COUNTY CONSOLIDATED SCHOOL CORPORATION
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignment, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.?
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open --  For a library card: Living or own property in Jefferson County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open --  For a library card: Living or own property in Jefferson County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Jefferson County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Jefferson County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Jefferson County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Jefferson County

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF JEFFERSON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that builds affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF JEFFERSON COUNTY
service_description: Providing home ownership sweat equity program; working in partnership with people in need of renovating and/or building affordable housing, houses are sold to those in need at no profit and with no interest charged
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-60% of area median -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit or can show progress toward that goal

agency_name: MADISON AREA EDUCATIONAL SPECIAL SERVICES UNIT
agency_desc: A government educational organization serving five school corporations, in four counties focused on students having the opportunity to develop skills to pursue further goals in education, independent living, and personal growth.
site_name: MADISON AREA EDUCATIONAL SPECIAL SERVICES UNIT
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in the Scott County School District 1, Crothersville Community Schools, Southwestern Jefferson County, Switzerland County, or Clarksville Community School District -- Ages 3-22 years-old -- With any form of disability that requires special education services   (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit youth shelter focused on promoting the well-being and healthy development of youth and families in a safe environment.
service_description: Providing Jefferson County Youth shelter program services; 24 hour emergency care for youth, age 10 -18 years-old, within a residential home of 10 beds, for both male and females, referred primarily through the Indiana Department of Child Services and Juvenile Probation Department
site_details: Call for information and intake.
site_eligibility: Living in Jefferson County -- Age 10-18 years-old

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Solicits individual and corporate donations to fund and support partner agencies and programs that address human service needs in Jefferson County. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.
site_details: Human service agencies and individuals wishing to make donations, call or visit website for information. -- Persons seeking assistance or wishing to access services funded by United Way, call 2-1-1.
site_eligibility: Human services agencies in Jefferson County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization exists to promote community and an economic environment where businesses prosper through vision, support and resources to develop business, and lead the business community.
service_description: Provides business consultation, tourist information, maps, and contributes toward the regional economic development of the community.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Jefferson County area businesses

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Jefferson County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignment, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.?
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: (MFD) fire department , volunteer fire department, provides fire and rescue services for residents of Madison Indiana
service_description: Providing fire fighting services to respond to structure fires, wild fires, hazardous material spills, vehicle extrication  and high-angle rescues, also assist with medical emergencies and other emergencies when requested with all volunteer unit serving, the city of Madison, Indiana.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit residential program for women in recovery from alcohol and/or substance abuse focused on addressing the substance abuse epidemic in the local and surrounding counties located in Jefferson County
service_description: Provide a residential living program for women in recovery from substance abuse; designed to provide a structured, supportive environment which encourages healthy behaviors & routines for transitioning back to society
taxonomy_name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call to register.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Females -- Willingness to enter into 6-month program -- Must be able to work/pay rent -- Free from withdrawal symptoms -- Free from health conditions that require medical treatment in another setting -- From from psychological needs which would require supervision or which would prevent the ability to meet demands of program -- Able to take and pass a urine drug screen -- Able to pay first week's rent and drug test $140

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Jefferson County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases in Jefferson County. The clerk's office issues marriage licenses; files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, custody/visitation, expungement, and protective orders; processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, traffic tickets, bail bonds, and other judgments; issues arrest warrants; and oversees all elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Jefferson County
